body:
https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/modules#$app-navigation-beforenavigate

Your `beforeNavigate` callback being called in this instance sounds correct to me. It's still a navigation (and one that you can `cancel()`), even if it's not going to be handled by client-side routing. There are [other fields](https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/types#public-types-navigation) available to you that perhaps you should be using in your code for copying query parameters, in particular `willUnload`.

@Conduitry Thanks so much for the quick response!

The issue is not that `beforeNavigate` is being called on the external link, it is that before the link is clicked the `search` property of `from.url` is correct (ie, it is `?appKey=12345`) but after you click the link, the `search` property of `from.url` is now empty, even though the URL hasn't changed and the address bar still contains the query parameters.
You'll want to check the type of the navigation in `beforeNavigate` before accessing `from.url.search`. It's technically correct that `search` is empty when clicking on the download link.

@s3812497 Sorry if we were not clear, but the issue is happening when you click on a link *after* the download link. You are correct that the search is empty when clicking on the download link, but once the download is complete and another link on the page is clicked, I would expect the from.url.search to match the browser's address bar?

> @s3812497 Sorry if we were not clear, but the issue is happening when you click on a link _after_ the download link. You are correct that the search is empty when clicking on the download link, but once the download is complete and another link on the page is clicked, I would expect the from.url.search to match the browser's address bar?

Thank you for the clarification. I think the issue is that after clicking on the "external" link (in this case the download), [sveltekit sets the `navigating` flag to true but never resets it on the next click.](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/a59997dbe2ceb0706bca360528c8362f5dc6d31a/packages/kit/src/runtime/client/client.js#L1519) Hence, [clicking on your next link doesn't call `beforeNavigate`.](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/a59997dbe2ceb0706bca360528c8362f5dc6d31a/packages/kit/src/runtime/client/client.js#L1084)

The simple fix would be to [reset `navigating` to false for the `click` event listener.](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/a59997dbe2ceb0706bca360528c8362f5dc6d31a/packages/kit/src/runtime/client/client.js#L1475) Although, I'm not sure if this will have any unintended side-effects?
@s3812497 I think in our case beforeNavigate is firing when clicking on the next link after the navigation, just not with the correct information?

> @s3812497 I think in our case beforeNavigate is firing when clicking on the next link after the navigation, just not with the correct information?

I can't seem to reproduce this. I can click on download and it will console.log the search params in `beforeNavigate`, but clicking on a subsequent valid navigation doesn't retain the `searchParams` set by `beforeNavigate` because of the bug that causes it to be skipped.
@s3812497 I will look at this today, and either confirm I agree with you, or provide a REPL reproduction for what I thought was happening. Thanks for your time!

rename.from: Svelte-kit tries to navigate on an a tag with the download attribute
rename.to: <a download /> prevents subsequent beforeNavigate from running

rename.from: <a download /> prevents subsequent beforeNavigate from running

rename.to: clicking on `<a download />` prevents subsequent `beforeNavigate` from running

body:
@s3812497 I wasn't able to reproduce what I thought I was seeing when I looked at this previously. I was able to confirm your summary is correct - clicking on `<a download />` prevents subsequent `beforeNavigate` from running.

Thanks again for taking a look at this.

issue.title: run `beforeNavigate` callbacks after cancelled unloading navigation
issue.body:
closes #9170

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [x] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. Changesets that add features should be `minor` and those that fix bugs should be `patch`. Please prefix changeset messages with `feat:`, `fix:`, or `chore:`.
